definitions.definition: (heading) To position or be positioned physically.
(heading) To position or be positioned mentally.
(heading) To position or be positioned socially.
Of a ship or its captain, to steer, sail (in a specified direction, for a specified destination etc.).
To remain without ruin or injury.
To stop asking for more cards; to keep one's hand as it has been dealt so far.
Not transitory; not liable to fade or vanish; lasting.

definitions.example: a standing bed, distinguished from a trundle-bed

definitions.definition: Position or reputation in society or a profession.
definitions.example: He does not have much of a standing as a chemist.

definitions.definition: The act of a person who stands, or a place where someone stands.
definitions.example: I think in deep mire, where there is no standing. — Psalms lxix. 2.

definitions.definition: The position of a team in a league or of a player in a list.
definitions.example: After their last win, their standing went up three places.

definitions.definition: Room in which to park a vehicle or vehicles
The right of a party to bring a legal action, based on the relationship between that party and the matter to which the action relates.
definitions.example: He may be insulting, a miserable rotter and a fool, but unless he slanders or libels you, or damages your property, you do not have standing to sue him.
